fast3d.util.serial

Class VecBinaryReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.util.serial.BinaryReader
      • fast3d.util.serial.VecBinaryReader

  • public class VecBinaryReader
extends BinaryReader
    providing the possibility to read vectors
    can be treated as a BinaryWriter
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VecBinaryReader(java.io.InputStream stream)
      just calls super-constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2d read2()
      reads the vectors double-coordinates and generates a single vector from them
      Vector2d[] read2(int amount)
      reads all needed double-coordinates and generates vectors of them
      Vector3d read3()
      reads the vectors double-coordinates and generates a single vector from them
      Vector3d[] read3(int amount)
      reads all needed double-coordinates and generates vectors of them
      Vector4d read4()
      reads the vectors double-coordinates and generates a single vector from them
      Vector4d[] read4(int amount)
      reads all needed double-coordinates and generates vectors of them
      Color readColor()
      just another way of writing read4() - but read4() gives no color
      Color[] readColor(int amount)
      just another way of writing read4(amount) - but read4() gives no color
      Material readMaterial()
      deserializes a single color of the stream

      • readColor

        public Color readColor()
        just another way of writing read4() - but read4() gives no color
        Returns:
        a single color or null if something went wrong
        See Also:
        read4()

      • readColor

        public Color[] readColor(int amount)
        just another way of writing read4(amount) - but read4() gives no color
        Parameters:
        amount - the count of colors to read
        Returns:
        a color-array or null if something went wrong
        See Also:
        read4(int)

      • readMaterial

        public Material readMaterial()
        deserializes a single color of the stream
